meanings.def: to cause something to start or develop, especially suddenly
examples: spark something The proposal would spark a storm of protest around the country.
Winds brought down power lines, sparking a fire.
The organizers are hoping to spark some interest in young people.
spark something off The riots were sparked off by the arrest of a local leader.

meanings.def: to produce small flashes of fire or electricity
examples: a sparking, crackling fire
(figurative) The game suddenly sparked to life.

meanings.def: a very small burning piece of material that is produced by something that is burning or by hitting two hard substances together
examples: A shower of sparks flew up the chimney.
A spark from the machinery had set fire to some material.
Flying sparks set fire to the dry grass.
His iron-tipped stick struck sparks from the pavement.
The firework showered sparks all over the lawn.
The grinding wheel sent a shower of sparks across the workbench.

meanings.def: a small flash of light produced by an electric current
examples: sparks from a faulty light switch
A spark ignites the fuel in a car engine.

meanings.def: a small amount of a particular quality or feeling
examples: a spark of hope
The woman’s eyes still had a spark of life in them.
She didn't have a spark of talent in her.
He had kindled a spark of interest within her.

meanings.def: a special quality of energy, intelligence or enthusiasm that makes somebody very clever, funny, etc.
examples: As a writer he seemed to lack creative spark.
She was a real star. She had a certain spark—that something extra.
The players have shown that they still possess the spark to make a fight of it.
She had lost none of the spark that had made her such an endearing young bride.
His performances lack creative spark.
Her performance added a little spark to the movie.

meanings.def: an action or event that causes something important to develop, especially trouble or violence
examples: These were the sparks of revolution.

meanings.def: feelings of anger or excitement between people
examples: Sparks flew at the meeting (= there was a lot of argument).
She was suddenly aware of the romantic spark between them.
His remarks drew sparks from her.
She felt a little spark of anger.
Her eyes shot sparks of contempt.

meanings.def: a lively and intelligent person, especially somebody young
examples: Some bright spark (= stupid person) left the tap running all night.

idioms.def: a lively and intelligent person, especially somebody young
examples: Some bright spark (= stupid person) left the tap running all night.
